, O
parallelism O
, O
speed O
and O
the O

to O
reveal O
the O
" O
big O
picture O
, O
" O
they O
have O
a O

of O

. O

They O
can O
not O
only O
be O

as O

in O

and O

Biochips O
come O
in O
two O
main O
types O
: O
the O
microfluidics O
chip O
or O
" O
lab O
- O
on O
- O
a O
- O
chip O
, O
" O
and O
the O
microarray O
chip O
or O
" O
DNA O
chip O
. O
" O

Microfluidics O
chips O
bring O
together O
biotechnology O
, O
microelectronics O
, O
micromachining O
and O
other O
technologies O
to O
integrate O
the O
functions O
of O
multiple O
laboratory O
instruments O
onto O
a O
single O
chip O
in O
miniaturized O
form O
. O

Meanwhile O
on O
microarray O
chips O
, O
biological O
molecules O
such O
as O
gene O
segments O
, O
oligonucleotides O
, O
proteins O
or O
antibodies O
are O
bound O
to O
the O
chip O
surface O
in O
an O
array O
of O
tiny O
spots O
, O
and O
a O
single O
chip O
may O
carry O
many O
tens O
of O
thousands O
of O
such O
spots O
. O

BMEC B-ORG
researcher O
Pan B-PER
Chao I-PER
- I-PER
chi I-PER
uses O
the O
example O
of O
blood O
screening O
for O
a O

bank O
to O

the O
difference O
between O
the O
two O
kinds O
of O
chips O
. O

To O
test O
a O

sample O
using O
a O
microarray O
chip O
, O

must O
first O
go O
through O
many O
preparatory O
steps O
such O
as O

, O
nucleotide O

, O
copying O
, O
amplification O
and O

before O
being O
put O
onto O
the O
chip O
where O
the O
" O
hybridization O
" O
reaction O
takes O
place O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
results O
are O
analyzed O
using O
a O
detection O
system O
. O

Hence O
these O
chips O
are O
only O
suitable O
for O
use O
in O
the O
laboratory O
. O

In O
contrast O

with O
a O

- O

- O

. O

Tips O
for O
Getting O
through O
Middle O
Age O

-LRB- O
Laura B-PER
Li I-PER
/ O
photos O
by O
Hsueh B-PER
Chi I-PER
- I-PER
kuang I-PER
/ O
tr. O
by O
Jonathan B-PER
Barnard I-PER
-RRB- O

Middle O
age O
and O
the O
changes O
it O
brings O
are O
like O
a O
revolving O
door O
. O

Many O
people O
peacefully O
go O
through O
it O
, O
growing O
wiser O
and O
losing O
their O
rough O
edges O
. O

A O
minority O
do O
n't O
know O
whether O
to O
advance O
or O
retreat O
and O
get O
caught O
in O
it O
like O
a O
trap O
. O

Middle O
age O
is O
a O
time O
where O
one O
wears O
more O
hats O
than O
at O
any O
other O
time O
in O
one O
's O
life O
, O
when O
one O
's O
responsibilities O
are O
heaviest O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
the O
crises O
experienced O
by O
a O
minority O
of O
middle O
- O
aged O
people O
can O
involve O
a O
lot O
of O
other O
people O
, O
so O
their O
impact O
can O
not O
be O
overlooked O
. O

Middle O
age O
, O
those B-MISC
years I-MISC
between I-MISC
40 I-MISC
and I-MISC
60 I-MISC
, O
is O
both O
the O
time O
of O
life O
of O
greatest O
glory O
and O
the O
time O
of O
life O
that O
's O
easiest O
to O
overlook O
. O

In O
comparison O
to O
youth O
or O
old O
age O
, O
the O
middle O
years O
are O
often O
thought O
of O
as O
the O
time O
when O
power O
, O
ability O
, O
wealth O
, O
and O
physical O
strength O
are O
all O
at O
or O
near O
their O
peak O
, O
so O
that O
one O
has O
no O
excuse O
for O
feeling O
melancholy O
. O

Even O
if O
there O
are O
problems O
, O
it O
is O
commonly O
thought O
that O
one O
should O
be O
able O
to O
resolve O
them O
by O
oneself O
, O
notes O
Chiu B-PER
Chia I-PER
- I-PER
li I-PER
, O
director O
of O
the B-ORG
Hwo I-ORG
Chyuan I-ORG
Pastoral I-ORG
Counseling I-ORG
Center I-ORG
, O
who O
has O
worked O
on O
many O
middle O
- O
aged O
cases O
. O

Social O
bias O
makes O
many O
of O
the O
middle O
aged O
afraid O
to O
discuss O
their O
problems O
. O

This O
is O
particularly O
the O
case O
for O
men O
, O
who O
generally O
find O
it O
difficult O
to O
talk O
about O
their O
feelings O
. O

But O
by O
keeping O
everything O
inside O
, O
they O
may O
cause O
irreparable O
harm O
to O
their O
health O
. O

In O
recent O
years O
cancer O
, O
sudden O
death O
and O
suicide O
have O
become O
all O
too O
common O
during O
middle O
age O
, O
which O
shows O
that O
the O
psychological O
problems O
of O
the O
middle O
- O
aged O
should O
not O
be O
overlooked O
. O



How O
do O
you O
safely O
pass O
through O
the O
changes O
of O
the O
middle O
years O
? O

Here O
are O
a O
few O
suggestions O
: O

1. B-MISC
Live O
well O
at O
every O
stage O
of O
life O

Li B-PER
Liang I-PER
- I-PER
che I-PER
, O
a O
professor O
of O
psychology O
at O
National B-ORG
Chengchi I-ORG
University I-ORG
, O
looks O
at O
the O
question O
from O
the O
angle O
of O
developmental O
psychology O
. O

He O
points O
out O
that O
the O
path O
of O
life O
is O
continuous O
: O
everyone O
moves O
from O
infancy O
and O
childhood O
, O
to O
youth O
and O
middle O
age O
. O

Smoothly O
passing O
through O
any O
period O
of O
life O
helps O
make O
getting O
through O
the O
next O
period O
easier O
. O

In O
other O
words O
, O
the O
people O
most O
at O
risk O
during O
middle O
age O
are O
those O
who O
have O
had O
difficulties O
earlier O
in O
life O
. O

Foreign O
research O
shows O
that O
those O
with O
high O
social O
and O
economic O
status O
and O
with O
ample O
financial O
resources O
bear O
up O
better O
during O
crisis O
and O
have O
more O
ways O
to O
get O
out O
of O
trouble O
. O

Is O
it O
too O
late O
to O
start O
talking O
about O
these O
problems O
when O
you O
are O
already O
middle O
- O
aged O
? O

Chang B-PER
Der I-PER
- I-PER
chung I-PER
, O
an O
associate O
professor O
in O
the O
Department B-ORG
of I-ORG
Living I-ORG
Science I-ORG
at I-ORG
National I-ORG
Open I-ORG
University I-ORG
who O
worked O
at O
a O
counseling O
hotline O
for O
over B-MISC
a I-MISC
decade I-MISC
, O
argues O
that O
any O
step O
in O
the O
right O
direction O
is O
worthwhile O
, O
no O
matter O
when O
you O
start O
. O

Middle O
- O
aged O
problems O
are O
rather O
predictable O
, O
and O
they O
're O
not O
hard O
to O
avoid O
. O

Are O
you O
worried O
that O
your O
marriage O
is O
growing O
stale O
? O

Then O
no O
matter O
how O
busy O
you O
are O
, O
you O
've O
got O
to O
set O
aside O
some O
time O
to O
be O
with O
your O
spouse O
. O

Are O
you O
worried O
about O
losing O
your O
job O
? O

Then O
start O
developing O
a O
second B-MISC
skill O
and O
get O
into O
the O
habit O
of O
saving O
and O
managing O
your O
money O
. O

Are O
you O
worried O
about O
how O
to O
care O
for O
your O
parents O
when O
they O
get O
old O
and O
sick O
? O

Then O
spend O
more O
time O
with O
them O
, O
and O
encourage O
them O
to O
get O
more O
exercise O
and O
take O
care O
of O
themselves O
. O

There O
are O
so O
many O
things O
to O
be O
concerned O
about O
during O
middle O
age O
that O
you O
had O
better O
get O
an O
early O
start O
. O

Otherwise O
, O
you O
'll O
end O
up O
being O
overwhelmed O
. O



2. B-MISC
Start O
over O

In O
China B-LOC
it O
used O
to O
be O
said O
that O
middle O
age O
was O
the O
period O
when O
one O
was O
" O
heir O
to O
the O
ancient O
sages O
and O
the O
teacher O
of O
posterity O
. O
" O

But O
now O
times O
are O
changing O
so O
fast O
that O
perhaps O
the O
lessons O
of O
past O
experience O
are O
no O
longer O
suitable O
for O
solving O
today O
's O
problems O
. O

To O
assume O
a O
posture O
of O
superiority O
based O
on O
one O
's O
seniority O
will O
make O
one O
despised O
. O

Hence O
, O
it O
is O
necessary O
to O
cast O
aside O
one O
's O
old O
self O
and O
start O
over O
. O

Chiu B-PER
notes O
that O
many O
middle O
- O
aged O
who O
have O
worked O
diligently O
for O

are O

work O
in O
the O
city O
all O

in O
China B-LOC
, O
thus O

20 B-MISC
million I-MISC
left O
- O
behind O
children O
. O

I O
want O
to O

them O
that O

miss O

a O
lot O
. O

Day O

long O
for O
love O
in O

for O

, O
that O

feeling O
weighing O
on O

, O

much O

could O
n't O

, O

; O

was O

. O

But O

something O
; O

- O

makes O
no O

. O

; O

, O

. O

Even O

' O

and O

' O

all O
got O

. O

Friends O
, O

's O
always O
friends O
who O
help O

. O

Many O
friends O
got O

they O
knew O
to O

, O

out O

, O

call O
and O

. O

There O
was O
one B-MISC

who O
had O
just O
got O

, O
but O
he O
did O

, O

. O

. O

Eliminate O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
-LRB- O
Reproduced O
from O
Yueguang B-MISC
blog I-MISC
-RRB- O
. O

Dift B-PER
Wu I-PER

Official O
data O
confirm O
that O
in O
2004 B-MISC
the O
total O
personal O
income O
tax O
for O
the O
country O
amounted O
to O
approximately B-MISC
181 I-MISC
billion I-MISC
, O
of O
which O
65 B-MISC
% I-MISC
came O
from O
the O
working O
class O
, O
and O
only O
10 B-MISC
% I-MISC
came O
from O
the O
wealthy O
. O

Clearly O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
policy O
has O
too O
little O
effect O
on O
controlling O
wealth O
accumulation O
by O
the O
rich O
, O
and O
too O
little O
impact O
on O
improving O
the O
quality O
of O
life O
of O
wage O
earners O
. O

While O
this O
type O
of O
tax O
in O
China B-LOC
has O
no O
effect O
on O
regulating O
the O
income O
gap O
or O
on O
" O
taking O
from O
the O
rich O
to O
help O
the O
poor O
, O
" O
neither O
is O
it O
beneficial O
in O
expanding O
the O
working O
class O
. O

If O
this O
tax O
continues O
to O
be O
collected O
, O
it O
will O
be O
working O
against O
the O
original O
intention O
behind O
the O
income O
tax O
. O

Clearly O
the O
necessity O
for O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
needs O
to O
be O
challenged O
. O

I O
propose O
eliminating O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
just O
as O
the O
agricultural O
tax O
was O
eliminated O
, O
to O
give O
people O
an O
opportunity O
to O
prosper O
. O

If O
we O
think O
in O
terms O
of O
humanizing O
the O
system O
, O
i.e. O
, O
helping O
the O
poor O
by O
letting O
poor O
people O
get O
rich O
, O
we O
should O
give O
low O
- O
and O
moderate O
- O
income O
people O
a O
chance O
to O
improve O
and O
raise O
the O
quality O
of O
their O
lives O
; O
the O
threshold O
for O
China B-LOC
's O
personal O
income O
tax O
should O
be O
at O
least O
tripled O
from O
the O
starting O
threshold O
of O
800 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
per O
month O
, O
i.e. O
, O
to O
6400 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
per O
person O
. O

That O
would O
take O
it O
to O
a O
minimally O
humanized O
level O
, O
and O
then O
we O
could O
really O
talk O
about O
" O
people O
first B-MISC
. O
" O

With O
a O
threshold O
below O
this O
level O
, O
the O
poor O
will O
always O
be O
poor O
. O

Yesterday O
CCTV B-ORG
presented O
a O
program O
on O
adjustment O
of O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
, O
emphasized O
that O
the O
main O
goal O
of O
the O
adjustment O
was O
to O
" O
take O
from O
the O
rich O
" O
and O
let O
poor O
people O
get O
wealthy O
. O

If O
we O
really O
want O
to O
give O
poor O
people O
a O
chance O
to O
get O
wealthy O
, O
the O
threshold O
for O
the O
personal O
income O
tax O
should O
be O
tripled O
. O

With O
anything O
under O
this O
threshold O
, O
the O
poor O
will O
have O
no O
chance O
to O
get O
rich O
. O

And O
if O
we O
're O
looking O
at O
it O
in O
terms O
of O
" O
taking O
from O
the O
rich O
, O
" O
the O
problem O
to O
be O
adjusted O
is O
definitely O
not O
whether O
or O
not O
to O
tax O
income O
but O
rather O
the O
problem O
of O

for O

China B-LOC
's O
social O
national O
income O
, O
namely O
how O
to O
eliminate O
the O
" O
unreported O
income O
. O
" O

The O
income O
of O
the O
vast O
majority O
of O
China B-LOC
's O
rich O
people O
is O
unreported O
income O
, O
and O
unreported O
income O
is O
a O
problem O
that O
Chinese B-MISC
society O
will O
not O
be O
able O
to O
solve O
for O
quite O
a O
long O
time O
to O
come O
; O

is O
a O
characteristic O
of O
China B-LOC
, O
an O
uncontrollable O
black O
hole O
in O
China B-LOC
's O
social O

. O

This O
is O
far O
from O
being O
a O
tax O
problem O
; O

is O

deeper O
systemic O
problem O
. O

If O
China B-LOC
's O
personal O
income O
tax O
can O
not O
achieve O
the O
effect O
of O
helping O
the O
poor O
to O

rich O
, O

what O

to O

? O

It O
would O

to O

it O
in O

fell O

, O
as O
we O
did O
with O
the O

tax O
. O

Below O
are O
some O
of O
the O
main O
reasons O
: O

1. B-MISC
China B-LOC
's O
income O
tax O
can O
not O
become O
a O
tool O
for O
keeping O
the O
poor O
perpetually O
poor O
; O
it O
can O
not O
become O
a O
social O
tool O
that O
keeps O
on O
producing O
a O
penniless O
proletariat O
. O

In O
China B-LOC
the O
primary O
function O
of O
the O
income O
tax O
is O
to O
increase O
the O
state O
's O
financial O
revenues O
; O
it O
is O
not O
to O
regulate O
the O
income O
gap O
. O

In O
2004 B-MISC
China B-LOC
's O
income O
taxes O
amounted O
to O
approximately B-MISC
180 I-MISC
billion I-MISC
, O
accounting O
for O
about B-MISC
6 I-MISC
% I-MISC
of O
the O
state O
's O
financial O
revenues O
. O

But O
of O
this O
180 B-MISC
billion I-MISC
, O
about B-MISC
65 I-MISC
% I-MISC
, O
or O
117 B-MISC
billion I-MISC
, O
was O
paid O
by O
the O
working O
class O
. O

Less B-MISC
than I-MISC
10 I-MISC
% I-MISC
was O
paid O
by O
the O
wealthy O
. O

In O
China B-LOC
more B-MISC
than I-MISC
90 I-MISC
% I-MISC
of O
the O
people O
who O
depend O
on O
fully O
declared O
total O
earnings O
for O
a O
living O
are O
urban O
poor O
. O

These O
poor O
people O
, O
who O
struggle O
just O
to O
pay O
for O
the O

of O
life O
, O

's O

, O

, O

and O

, O
also O
have O
to O
pay O
income O
tax O
. O

In O
all O
of O
China B-LOC
's O
cities O
now O
, O
anyone O
with O
a O
monthly O
income O
of O
2000 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
or I-MISC
less I-MISC
is O
considered O
poor O
. O

If O
a O
husband O
and O
wife O
have O
a O
total O
monthly O

of O
2000 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
, O

33 B-MISC
% I-MISC

on O
anything O
over B-MISC
1500 I-MISC
yuan I-MISC
, O
they O
have O
a O
disposable O
income O
of O
only O
1670 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
. O

A O
household O
like O
this O
can O
not O
even O
continue O
bearing O
basic O
living O
expenses O
, O
and O

of O
living O
will O
decline O
. O

And O

the O
household O
get O

and O

go O
to O
the O
hospital O
, O

may O

. O

And O
if O

like O
this O
wants O
to O

its O
own O
home O
, O
that O
will O
basically O
be O
impossible O
. O

And O
if O
only O
one B-MISC
person O
in O
a O
three B-MISC
- O
person O
family O
is O
employed O
, O
the O
family O
will O
have O
a O

difficult O
life O
. O

But O
even O

, O
they O
have O
to O
pay O
165 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
in O
income O
tax O
. O

Clearly O
, O
if O
our O
income O
tax O
threshold O
is O
set O
at O
1500 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
, O
our O

is O
destined O
always O
to O

, O
always O
to O

to O

or O

of O
ever O

rich O
. O

Our O
production O
relations O
are O
no O
different O
from O
the O
production O
relations O
in O
Marx B-PER
's O
" O
Das B-MISC
Kapital I-MISC
, O
" O
constantly O
reproducing O
a O

who O
can O
only O
rely O
on O

to O

. O

In O

, O

threshold O
is O

6400 B-MISC
yuan I-MISC
, O

. O

Conversely O
, O

, O

will O
cleanly O
and O

inhibit O

of O

to O

. O



2. B-MISC
The O
personal O
income O
tax O
is O
absolutely O
unable O
to O

the O

of O
wealth O
by O

. O

We O
should O
not O

that O

's O

can O
in O

way O

" O

from O

. O
" O

In O

society O
, O
20 B-MISC
% I-MISC
of O

hold O
80 B-MISC
% I-MISC

, O

for O

, O

; O

have O

, O

. O

When O

, O

% I-MISC
; O

ca O
n't O

. O

The O

of O

of O
these O
20 B-MISC
, O
of O

- O
class O
citizens O
in O

is O

; O

Only O

. O

That O

China O
is O
probably O
approaching O
the O
turning O
point O
at O
which O
overall O
inflation O
starts O
to O
decline O
. O

The O

of O
pork O
has O
always O
been O
one O
of O
the O
main O
reasons O
for O
the O
overall O
inflation O
to O
skyrocket O
. O

However O
, O
in O
recent O
weeks O
, O

food O
prices O
have O
been O
stable O
or O
declining O
, O
relieving O

over O

of O

. O

For O

, O

the O

of O
China O
shows O
that O
as O
of O
February O
, O

price O
of O
fresh O
pork O
had O
been O
steadily O
rising O
to O
nearly O
23 O
yuan O
per O
kilogram O
-LRB- O
equivalent O
to O
3.29 O
U.S. O
dollars O
-RRB- O
. O

Since O
then O
, O
the O
price O
has O
basically O

, O
falling O
back O
at O
22.21 O
yuan O
last O
week O
. O

Even O
if O

prices O
of O
products O
like O
pork O
do O
not O
drop O
, O
the O
inflation O
rate O
may O
also O
decline O
. O

Since O
China O
's O
CPI O
altogether O
broke O
through O
5 O
% O
in O
July O
of O
last O
year O
, O
the O
base O
of O
comparison O
for O
last O
year O
's O
prices O
will O
be O
significantly O
raised O
, O
starting O
from O
July O
this O
year O
. O

If O
no O

increase O
in O
prices O
has O

by O
that O
time O
, O
then O
as O
time O
goes O
on O
, O
the O
year O
- O
on O
- O
year O
increase O
rate O
of O
prices O
will O
decline O
. O

The O
soaring O
food O
prices O
have O
indeed O

Saul O
went O
to O
Damascus O
. O

When O
he O
came O
near O
the O
city O
, O
a O
very O
bright O
light O
from O
heaven O
suddenly O
shined O
around O
him O
. O

He O
fell O
to O
the O
ground O
and O
heard O
a O
voice O
saying O
to O
him O
, O
`` O
Saul O
, O
Saul O
! O

Why O
are O
you O
persecuting O
me O
? O
'' O

Saul O
said O
, O
`` O
Who O
are O
you O
, O
Lord O
? O
'' O

The O
voice O
answered O
, O
`` O
I O
am O
Jesus O
, O
the O
one O
you O
are O
persecuting O
. O

Get O
up O
now O
and O
go O
into O
the O
city O
. O

Someone O
there O
will O
tell O
you O
what O
you O
must O
do O
. O
'' O

The O
men O
traveling O
with O
Saul O
just O
stood O
there O
, O
unable O
to O
speak O
. O

They O
heard O
the O
voice O
, O
but O
they O
saw O
no O
one O
. O

Saul O
got O
up O
from O
the O
ground O
and O
opened O
his O
eyes O
, O
but O
he O
could O
not O
see O
. O

So O
the O
men O
with O
him O
held O
his O
hand O
and O
led O
him O
into O
Damascus O
. O

For O
three O
days O
Saul O
could O
not O
see O
; O
he O
did O
not O
eat O
or O
drink O
. O

There O
was O
a O
follower O
of O
Jesus O
in O
Damascus O
named O
Ananias O
. O

In O
a O
vision O

Lord O

, O
`` O
Ananias O
! O
'' O

Ananias O
answered O
, O
`` O
Here O
I O
am O
, O
Lord O
. O
'' O

The O

said O
to O

, O
`` O
Get O

and O

to O

. O

Find O

of O
Judas O
and O

a O

from O

. O

He O
is O
there O

, O

. O

on O

so O
that O

see O
again O
. O
'' O

, O
`` O

, O

. O

, O

that O

's O

. O

He O
was O

to O

! O

. O

After O

, O

to O

. O

Saul O

with O

of O

. O

Soon O

. O

. O

His O

could O
not O

. O



After O

, O

to O

. O

the O

. O

, O

. O

One O

. O

They O

down O

. O

Then O
Saul O

to O

. O

He O

, O

. O

. O

. O

. O

. O

, O

. O

in O

, O

, O

. O

, O

and O

by O
the O

. O

So O

everywhere O

in O
numbers O
. O

Peter O
was O

, O

. O

. O

. O

. O

. O

. O

, O

. O

. O

. O

, O

, O

. O

. O

, O

. O

. O

. O

These O

were O
worth O

50 O
, O
000 O

coins O
. O

This O
is O
how O
the O

of O

was O

in O

, O

. O

After O

, O

. O

, O

. O

, O

, O

. O
'' O

Timothy O

. O

Paul O
sent O

ahead O
to O

. O

But O

in O

for O
a O

. O

But O

that O
time O
there O
was O
some O
trouble O
in O

about O
the O
Way O
. O

This O
is O
how O
it O
all O
happened O
: O
There O
was O
a O
man O
named O
Demetrius O
. O

He O
worked O
with O

. O

He O

that O

. O

The O

who O
did O

a O

. O

. O

to O

. O

. O

- O

" O

If O

- O

. O

For O

not O

of O

assets O

, O

of O

, O
etc O
. O

For O

with O
no O

of O

, O

must O

be O

to O

. O

At O

from O

should O
be O
used O
first O
to O
settle O
employees O
and O
insufficiencies O
should O
be O
made O
up O
for O
from O
the O
sale O
of O
real O
estate O
. O

Stock O
cooperatives O
are O
an O
important O
form O
of O
opening O
up O
small O
state O
- O
owned O
enterprises O
. O

Enterprises O
whose O
system O
is O
changed O
in O
this O
form O
can O
enjoy O
preferential O
policies O
, O
such O
as O
income O
taxes O
being O
returned O
when O
they O
exceed O
the O
base O
, O
temporarily O
not O
levying O
business O
tax O
on O
fixed O
assets O
, O
etc O
. O

For O
those O
implementing O
mergers O
, O
the O
merging O
party O
can O
enjoy O
policy O
- O
type O
loss O
subsidies O
of O
the O
merged O
enterprise O
, O
or O
the O
enterprise O
accumulation O
fund O
can O
also O
be O
used O
to O
compensate O
for O
loss O
, O
and O
insufficiencies O
can O
be O
listed O
as O
pre-tax O
expenditures O
. O

Non-bank O
debt O
of O
reformed O
enterprises O
can O
be O
transferred O
from O
creditor O
rights O
to O
stock O
ownership O
; O
those O
having O
difficulty O
paying O
taxes O

can O
implement O
" O
temporarily O

old O
debt O
but O
not O
owing O
on O
new O
taxes O

and O

, O

off O
year O

" O

After O
five O
years O
of O
negotiation O
process O
, O
the O
" O
Conventions O
on O
the O
Rights O
of O
Persons O
with O
Disabilities O
" O
was O
adopted O
by O
the O
United O
Nations O
General O
Assembly O
in O
December O
2006 O
, O
thus O
became O
the O
first O
human O
rights O
convention O
passed O
by O
international O
society O
in O
the O
21st O
century O
. O

The O
" O
Conventions O
on O
the O
Rights O
of O
Persons O
with O
Disabilities O
" O
was O
opened O
for O
signature O
of O
the O
member O
states O
of O
the O
United O
Nations O
since O
March O
30 O
, O
2007 O
. O

It O
came O
into O
effect O
once O
the O
states O
parties O
reached O
20 O
. O

Jamaica O
was O
the O
first O
country O
to O
officially O
approve O
the O
convention O
. O

On O
April O
3 O
of O
this O
year O
, O
Ecuador O
officially O
approved O
the O
convention O
and O
became O
the O
20th O
state O
party O
. O

The O
convention O
began O
to O
enter O
its O
30 O
- O
day O
automatic O
effective O
procedure O
. O

Up O
until O
now O
, O
127 O
countries O
have O
signed O
the O
convention O
, O
25 O
of O
which O
have O
officially O
approved O
it O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
the O
" O
Conventions O
on O
the O
Rights O
of O
Persons O
with O
Disabilities O
" O
is O
to O
promote O
, O
protect O
and O
ensure O
the O
full O
and O
equal O
enjoyment O
of O
all O
human O
rights O
and O
fundamental O
freedoms O
by O
all O
persons O
with O
disabilities O
, O
and O
to O
promote O
respect O
for O
their O
inherent O
dignity O
. O

Its O
key O
content O
is O
to O
ensure O
that O
persons O
with O
disabilities O
will O
enjoy O
the O
same O
rights O
as O
healthy O
people O
do O
and O
can O
live O
in O
the O
capacity O
of O
full O
citizens O
so O
that O
they O
can O
have O
equal O
opportunity O
to O
make O
valuable O
contributions O
to O
society O
. O




While O
residents O
of O
the O
richest O
province O
in O
Bolivia O
, O
Santa O
Cruz O
, O
were O
fervently O
celebrating O
the O
victory O
of O
a O
referendum O
on O
autonomy O
, O
President O
Morales O
warned O
that O
the O
referendum O
was O
" O
illegal O
and O
unconstitutional O
" O
. O

In O
a O
speech O
broadcast O
to O
the O
nation O
, O
Morales O
said O
, O
" O
The O
election O
is O
illegal O
and O
unconstitutional O
. O
It O
is O
not O
as O
successful O
as O
some O
families O
wished O
. O
" O

He O
claimed O
that O
the O
election O
was O
a O
" O
complete O
failure O
" O
, O
and O
stressed O
that O
the O
high O
rates O
of O
voter O
abstention O
and O
opposing O
votes O
has O
already O
made O
this O
referendum O
not O
legal O
. O

He O
said O
, O
" O
Unfortunately O
, O
the O
referendum O
has O
already O
split O
up O
the O
province O
of O
Santa O
Cruz O
. O
" O

Many O
people O
are O
worried O
about O
widespread O
instances O
of O
violence O
in O
Santa O
Cruz O
after O
the O
referendum O
. O

During O
the O
referendum O
, O
numerous O
conflicts O
have O
occurred O
between O
supporters O
and O
militants O
opposed O
to O
autonomy O
, O
injuring O
at O
least O
20 O
people O
. O

Military O
leaders O
of O
Bolivia O
said O
that O
they O
take O
this O
action O
of O
fighting O
for O
autonomy O
as O
a O
threat O
to O
the O
country O
's O
territorial O
integrity O
. O

Next O
month O
, O
three O
other O
provinces O
in O
the O
lower O
eastern O
region O
that O
are O
held O
by O
the O
opposition O
party O
will O
hold O
referenda O
on O
autonomy O
. O
By O
that O
time O
, O
this O
crisis O
will O
deepen O
. O

Two O
other O
provinces O
are O
also O
considering O
following O
suit O
; O
there O

of O

. O

The O
share O
of O
the O
spirited O
emerging O
markets O
within O
the O
world O
economy O
is O
growing O
. O

Particularly O
in O

and O
India O
, O

growths O
will O

to O

of O
the O
world O
economy O
. O

However O
, O

has O
also O

to O

increasingly O
sensitive O
to O

of O
these O

. O

Once O

, O
the O
world O
economy O
-LRB- O
especially O

-RRB- O
will O
also O

. O

The O

unit O
of O

of O
Britain O

that O
in O
2007 O
, O

will O
slow O
down O

, O
and O

will O

a O
mere O
2 O
% O
. O

that O

. O
